ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Forthcoming Atlas
ygData.msgSnippet: Agreed but why take on the task alone. Meaning, if they have a submission venue, which they may have, it would allow tons of people to venture and help write
ygData.messageBody:
Agreed but why take on the task alone. Meaning, if
they have a submission venue, which they may have, it
would allow tons of people to venture and help write
the descriptions....Then they could keep it up easily.

Actually one suggestion would be to take applications
from people and give them an area or zone for
specialty.

So I could take my 20 mage lets say and keep the guy
in EC and once per week waltz around and kill stuff to
see if anything changed or not.......as well as walk
the zone to remap any changes in landmarks.

I do agree with you and understand entirely.



--- Toni <silly_girl4ever@...> wrote:
>
> One thing that needs to be remembered.... those
> things DO take time.... not to mention that the
> people who do keep the websites more than likely
> PLAY everquest, which probably cuts into their
> time..... I know a few people who just have a hard
> enough time Feeding themselves.. let alone
> maintaining GREAT websites =D
> Katashaka Naboombu
> 46 Vah Shir Shaman
> Officer Claws of night (Vazaelle)
> Gwenievieve (no last name yet)
> 29 High Elf Cleric of Tunare
> Claws of Night (Vazaelle)
> Rob LeBeau wrote:I will say one thing......the
> Eqatlas.com's Luclin
> maps are ok but since Lucline has been out for a
> while, I would personally like to see some dangers
> and
> benefits which I think are lacking big time
> currently.
>
> There also needs to be updates to the existing
> maps...
> For example we raided Runnyeye the other day and a
> monk was looking for a quest item from floor 4. I
> was
> on floor two with another friend and it dropped off
> of
> something not even stated..... which is fine but it
> was not expected at all, updates like this would be
> great.
>
> my 2 cents
>
> --- "Steven R. Hulse" <shulse7@...> wrote:
> > I'll be picking it up too. EQ Atlas is a good
> > resource, however their
> > maps aren't the best IMHO. One, they need to be
> > consistence and have one
> > map that they update off the other maps they have.
> > Two, No cartoony
> > maps. It makes things a little too confusing; And
> > three, Add a legend to
> > the maps and include a N S E W compass. I'm not
> > saying they suck, just
> > would like to see some improvements. Hopefully
> > Verant's will be more
> > consistent.
> >
> > As for the dual monitor, It's easy, just have a
> > second video card
> > installed and run EQ on one and your other info on
> > the other. You may
> > have to tweak the settings a little but that
> > shouldn't be hard to do.
> > The monitors can be mapped to do this.
> >
> > C-ya!
> > Steve
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > Message: 1
> > Date: Mon, 26 Aug 2002 14:00:51 -0000
> > From: "mlockridge01" <MLockridge01@...>
> > Subject: Forthcoming Atlas
> >
> > I will probably buy the forthcoming atlas, once it
> > is out. It will be
> > cheaper than printing up the rest of the maps I
> > don't have, since I
> > have been only printing maps as I need them. Plus,
> > we ran out of ink
> > and nobody in my household wants to be the one to
> > spring for the new
> > ink. Probably because they know a large number of
> > maps will be
> > printed as soon as the ink is loaded. ;)
> >
> > What I would really like is to have eq in a
> window,
> > with a second
> > monitor to hold my data; maps, charts, lists, and
> > recipes. I know
> > there is a hack to allow this, but I would prefer
> a
> > sanctioned
> > window. Plus I don't have the horsepower on this
> > system to carry such
> > a load. My game would suffer.
> >
> > Twenty bucks for the atlas sounds cheaper all
> round.
> >
> > Barto Proudfoot
> >
> >
> >
>
>
